image.altText: A mid shot of Senator Linda Reynolds walking towards the camera outside court, dressed in black with spectacles and a bag.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins and her husband's true colours are on display in a series of text messages that mocked Senator Linda Reynolds after she was hospitalised with heart concerns, a WA court hears.

title.children: Linda Reynolds seeks more than $500k in Brittany Higgins defamation payout, court hears

image.altText: A mid-shot of accused rapist Farzam Mehrabi walking in front of a construction fence, wearing a suit and tie and white shirt.

props.synopsis: Farzam Mehrabi was captured on CCTV in bars, putting drugs into the drinks of women he was dating.

title.children: Perth dentist found guilty of drugging, raping women he met through dating apps

image.altText: The words ‘No Change To WA GST’ have been scrawled on a reporter's arm and signed by Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: The GST deal has been described as "the worst public policy decision in Australia so far this century" but none of the major parties will touch it for fear of upsetting Western Australia.

title.children: The major parties are stuck in a $53b GST trap — because no-one dares anger the Vengeful Deity of the West

image.altText: Firewood pile

props.synopsis: A warmer than average winter and cost-of-living challenges are hitting consumers, but the WA's biggest firewood businesses say illegal sales and harvesting are a massive problem.

title.children: Firewood suppliers point finger at online 'black market' amid record supply glut

image.altText: Alex Saffy in action during the 100m butterfly S10

props.synopsis: Alex Saffy, who has cerebral palsy, broke an Oceanic record with a 56.61-second finish in the men's 100m butterfly S10.

title.children: 'Bunbury Bullet' Alex Saffy celebrates emotional Paralympic swimming bronze

image.altText: Carnarvon fascine

props.synopsis: A multi-billion-dollar green hydrogen project tipped to transform the coastal town of Carnarvon into a clean energy hub is shelved, prompting questions about the viability of other projects in WA.

title.children: Another green energy project has hit the wall in WA — so where to from here?

image.altText: Building covered in scaffolding, construction, crane

props.synopsis: The federal government proposal is stranded in the Senate after the Coalition and the Greens both declared it would "do nothing" about housing affordability.

title.children: Labor's tax break for housing investors hits Senate snag

image.altText: Derby Taxis vehicle parked at the Derby jetty at sunset

props.synopsis: There's just one wheelchair accessible taxi for more than 35,000 people living in the Kimberley region which advocates say is isolating residents and tourists in towns such as Broome and Kununurra.

title.children: There's just one wheelchair taxi in far northern WA. Residents say that needs to change

image.altText: Ben O'Connor grimaces on the bike

props.synopsis: Ben O'Connor holds onto the red leader jersey at the Vuelta a España by just 5 seconds, but is left furious — and freezing — after a miscommunication at the finish line.

title.children: Podium confusion leaves WA cyclist O'Connor 'pissed' after 'heroic' ride to retain red jersey

image.altText: A smiling woman with a floral dress in the sunshine

props.synopsis: The Paralympics was the making of me — being around other strong, disabled bodies showed me that I could be proud of who I was. Now with the Paris Paralympics, it's time to help others realise the same.

title.children: Growing up, doctors despaired about my future. But finding para swimming taught me to have pride in my disability

image.altText: Close-up of electronic gaming machine screen.

props.synopsis: Australia has the highest gambling losses in the world, according to a new Grattan Institute report that calls on federal and state governments to stand up to "vested Interests" and implement a complete ban on gambling ads and limits on how much people can bet when at the pokies and via online betting platforms.

title.children: As the gambling ad ban debate heats up, there are calls for maximum loss limits for pokies and online betting

image.altText: Baby's hand in an adult hand

props.synopsis: A doctor who says he was "trying to console" his newborn son when he allegedly caused him grievous bodily harm is allowed to keep practising as WA's State Administrative Tribunal vetoes his suspension.

title.children: Perth doctor accused of fracturing baby son's leg and rib has medical suspension overturned

props.synopsis: The federal government has hosed down the calls from within its own ranks, as new data shows almost two-thirds of Australians delayed treatment due to cost.

title.children: 'I can look into a child's mouth and tell their parents' income': Labor backbench pushes for dental in Medicare

image.altText: A composite image of two men: Donald Trump and Anthony Scaramucci.

props.synopsis: Anthony Scaramucci did not last long in the Trump administration but he is certain of one thing: four more years of Trump could have potentially disastrous consequences for the United States and the world.

title.children: 'Malevolence, cruelty': Scaramucci issues warning on what four more years of Trump means

image.altText: A road can be see through the windscreen of a military vehicle

props.synopsis: For the first time in more than five years and since the Ukraine war began, the ABC crosses into Russia to see what life is like in the occupied city of Sudzha.

title.children: Ukraine's incursion means the world can see for itself what life is like inside Russia

image.altText: Yang Qian playing in the Paris Paralympics gold medal match.

props.synopsis: Yang Qian takes out the women's singles WS10 title following a dominant performance in the gold medal match, while Australia enjoys a stellar day in the individual time trial events on the road. Follow live.

title.children: Yang Qian wins second Paris gold, Australia claims five medals in para cycling

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Day seven: Aussies in action and medallists
Para cycling road: Donohoe wins silver for Australia
Para table tennis: Yang defends her Paralympic crown!

image.altText: Lauren Parker with her fellow medallists in the para cycling road at the Paris Paralympics.

props.synopsis: Australian Paralympic star Lauren Parker claims silver in the women's H1-3 individual time trial to add to her para triathlon gold in Paris.

title.children: Parker becomes Australia's first dual-sport Paralympic medallist in 44 years

image.altText: A serious-looking bald man in a suit and glasses stands in front of a sombre-looking background.

props.synopsis: Kim Williams uses his speech to insist all journalists need to earn the trust of their audiences, or risk being consigned to history.

title.children: ABC chair quotes JD Vance as he warns of diminishing trust in media

image.altText: On the left, an undamaged building; on the right, a building engulfed in flames.

props.synopsis: A public inquiry into the devastating 2017 London Grenfell Tower blaze blames the disaster on failings by government, the construction industry and most of all the firms involved in fitting the exterior with flammable cladding.

title.children: Grenfell Tower report lashes UK governments, construction industry for 'decades of failure'

image.altText: A woman wearing a green and gold tracksuit holds her hands like a kangaroo on a purple stage with judges behind her

props.synopsis: Breaker Rachel "Raygun" Gunn has spoken out about her performance at the Paris Olympics, and why she still finds it difficult to process.

title.children: 'Raygun' says she hasn't yet watched her viral Olympic breaking performance

image.altText: A person wheels their trolley past the end of a supermarket aisle. They are blurred from the motion and are not identifiable.

props.synopsis: New data shows households have been spending more in most categories, with the biggest increases coming in health care, food and services such as maintenance.

title.children: Australian household spending driven by bills to cover the necessities

image.altText: A top-down view of a building with its roof blown off, with rubble seen in a cavity through smoke.

props.synopsis: News of the deaths came as Russia also launched a missile attack on capital Kyiv, Ukraine military officials said.

title.children: At least seven killed in Russian drone attack on Lviv, Ukraine minister says

image.altText: A young woman with long dark hair looks into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's leading hospitality groups, Merivale, has been accused of fostering a culture that places women at risk, condones drug use by staff and patrons and fails to adequately address claims of sexual assault.

title.children: Female patrons claim they were introduced as sex workers to VIP guests at Merivale's Ivy nightclub

image.altText: A nurse extracts a vaccine from a small vial into a syringe.

props.synopsis: Two new COVID-19 vaccines targeting the JN.1 variant are under review by the TGA. We asked experts about the new vaccines and what we can expect if they're approved.

title.children: New COVID vaccines could soon be available. So when's the best time to get a booster?

image.altText: Woman with blonde wavy hair smiles at cameras

props.synopsis: Elle Macpherson has shared her life lessons in a new memoir, but revelations about her breast cancer treatment have come under fire from experts.

title.children: 'Incredibly irresponsible': Doctor slams Elle Macpherson's breast cancer treatment decision

image.altText: A man with a microphone

props.synopsis: A Queensland MP is facing criticism for speaking at a gathering of conspiracy theorists who erroneously claim vaccines cause stupidity and fire ant bait is harmful to fetal brain development.

title.children: MP slammed for speaking at 'scaremongering' rally that claimed fire ant bait shrinks babies' heads

image.altText: a woman with a coffee puts her credit card into an eftpos machine

props.synopsis: With the pandemic accelerating the use of cards instead of cash — only 13 per cent of Australians use cash, dropping from 27 per cent in the past five years — these extra charges have become mainstream.

title.children: Credit card surcharges are added to most purchases, but what are the rules behind these extra fees?

image.altText: Rebecca Gibney is perched on a pink exercise ball, a red one in her arms. Nicholas Brown stands beside her, holding another.

props.synopsis: The Logie Hall of Famer is one of many TV stars featuring in Sydney Theatre Company's 2025 slate, for the final season from outgoing artistic director Kip Williams.

title.children: Approaching 60, Rebecca Gibney feels ready to take a risk. That's why she's stepping back on stage

image.altText: Illawarra Mercury

props.synopsis: Australian Community Media will cut 35 editorial positions from newspapers across Australia in the latest budget cuts following the withdrawal of funding from Meta.

title.children: Communities the 'real losers' as ACM cuts dozens of editorial jobs

image.altText: An older man with white hair and beard with a video camera near his face.

props.synopsis: After the lifting of a lengthy suppression order, it can now be reported that Geoff Clark has been found guilty of 25 charges relating to about $1 million illegally obtained from his community's Aboriginal trust.

title.children: Former ATSIC head found guilty of defrauding his community of $1 million

image.altText: Palm trees throughout a valley of stepped rice paddies

props.synopsis: Bali boasts world-famous beach clubs, surf breaks and ancient Hindu temples. The only problem is, you often have to battle traffic to get to them.

title.children: Eat, pray, traffic jam: Bali's heaving roads may become a thing of the past with a $29 billion train line

image.altText: Regis McPhillamy signage

props.synopsis: The opposition asks Environment Minister Tanya Plibersek to reveal her reasons for granting an Aboriginal protection order over a site earmarked for a tailings dam at the McPhillamys Gold Mine development near Blayney in NSW.

title.children: Coalition challenges Plibersek to explain decision stalling development of $1 billion gold mine

image.altText: A woman in black suit walking out of court.

props.synopsis: Linda Sun, a former aide to New York Governor Kathy Hochulis, is charged with acting as an agent of the Chinese government in exchange for millions of dollars in compensation and gifts.

title.children: Ex-aide of New York governor charged over secretly acting as Chinese agent

image.altText: A family stand on a suburban street next to a bus stop pole.

props.synopsis: Advocates and refugee legal services say there's currently only one option for Palestinians who arrived in Australia on visitor visas since October: to embark on the often years-long process of seeking permanent asylum.

title.children: Darwish never planned on coming to Australia, but he has no choice but to apply to stay here permanently

image.altText: Yahya Sinwar, with grey hair and beard, has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: The US Department of Justice announces criminal charges against Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar and other senior militants in the first formal action taken by American law enforcement over the October 7 terrorist attack.

title.children: US Justice Department announces criminal charges against Hamas militants
